intro: [WRONG START] Vaccinium disterroides, commonly known as the dwarf blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries, which are typically dark blue when ripe, are edible and have a tart flavor. This species thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
